description:
This time it’ll be different. It’s a green field project and you’ve
learned from your mistakes. You’re not going to make the same ones
again.

Fast forward several months and you’re in a mess. A change in one place
causes bugs in a completely different place. Adding a simple feature
means making changes all over your application. Progress is getting
slower and slower. You’re lost in complexity.

Why does this keep happening and what can we do about it?

This talk will try to answer those questions.

I’ll show how complex software really is, define the different types of
complexity found in software, explain the issues complexity causes and
discuss different techniques we can use to manage it.

This talk is suitable for anyone who has worked or will work on a
software development project. No development experience is required.
title: Creating a Culture of Software Craftsmanship
